display_name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

atomic_tests.name: Create and Execute Batch Script
atomic_tests.description: Creates and executes a simple batch script. Upon execution, CMD will briefly launch to run the batch script then close again.

dependencies.description: Batch file must exist on disk at specified location (#{script_path})

atomic_tests.name: Writes text to a file and displays it.
atomic_tests.description: Writes text to a file and display the results. This test is intended to emulate the dropping of a malicious file to disk.

input_arguments.description: Path to the file that the command prompt will drop.
Message that will be written to disk and then displayed.
input_arguments.default: Hello from the Windows Command Prompt!

atomic_tests.name: Suspicious Execution via Windows Command Shell
atomic_tests.description: Command line executed via suspicious invocation. Example is from the 2021 Threat Detection Report by Red Canary.

atomic_tests.name: Simulate BlackByte Ransomware Print Bombing
atomic_tests.description:
This test attempts to open a file a specified number of times in Wordpad, then prints the contents. 
It is designed to mimic BlackByte ransomware's print bombing technique, where tree.dll, which contains the ransom note, is opened in Wordpad 75 times and then printed. 
See https://redcanary.com/blog/blackbyte-ransomware/.

executor.name: powershell
executor.procedure: cmd /c "for /l %x in (1,1,#{max_to_print}) do start wordpad.exe /p #{file_to_print}" | out-null

input_arguments.description: File to be opened/printed by Wordpad.
The maximum number of Wordpad windows the test will open/print.

dependencies.description: File to print must exist on disk at specified location (#{file_to_print})
dependencies.get_prereq_command: new-item "#{file_to_print}" -value "This file has been created by T1059.003 Test 4" -Force | Out-Null

atomic_tests.name: Command Prompt read contents from CMD file and execute
atomic_tests.description:
Simulate Raspberry Robin using the "standard-in" command prompt feature cmd `/R <` to read and execute a file via cmd.exe
See https://redcanary.com/blog/raspberry-robin/.

input_arguments.description: CMD file that is read by Command Prompt and execute, which launches calc.exe

dependencies.description: CMD file must exist on disk at specified location (#{input_file})

atomic_tests.name: Command prompt writing script to file then executes it
atomic_tests.description:
Simulate DarkGate malware's second stage by writing a VBscript to disk directly from the command prompt then executing it.
    The script will execute 'whoami' then exit.

executor.name: command_prompt
executor.procedure: c:\windows\system32\cmd.exe /c cd /d #{script_path} & echo Set objShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell"):Set objExec = objShell.Exec("whoami"):Set objExec = Nothing:Set objShell = Nothing > #{script_name}.vbs & #{script_name}.vbs

input_arguments.description: Path in which the script will be written.
